alert.note: Alert for Robertson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 3:18PM CDT until May 17 at 4:43AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Leon, Limestone and Robertson counties. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Trained spotters indicated the onset of minor flooding due to thunderstorms. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buffalo, Centerville, Lake Limestone, Twin Oak Reservoir, Corinth, Jewett, Redland, Thornton, Kosse, Marquez, Farrar, Robbins, Seale, Oletha, Ridge, Bald Prairie, Easterly, Pleasant Springs, Flo and Eunice.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
